titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the British authors collection M0121

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-10-03 12:26:22 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Literary manuscripts and letters of writers of the British Commonwealth. Correspondence, literary manuscripts, commonplace books, autographs, and photographs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] British authors collection, M0121, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

Book of Poems, Pageant of Empire, by Alfred Noyes. One is handwritten, the others, typed. All contain author's signature. Also contains a signed preface by Sir Charles Oman, by the Duke of Windsor, and three other letters relating to the Pageant of Empire, held at Wembley Stadium, London, in
